label: Boxplot
info: Produce box-and-whisker plot(s) of the given (grouped) value

categories.label: Input
categories.info: Controls to specify parameters of the boxplot

input_var.label: variable
input_var.info: A numeric variable for which the boxplot is to be constructed

input_group.label: grouping variable
input_group.info: a grouping variable, usually a factor, for constructing parallel boxplots

input_outline.label: show outliers
input_outline.info: if true, the outliers are drawn

input_xlab.label: X-axis label
input_xlab.info: text label for the horizontal (x) axis

input_ylab.label: Y-axis label
input_ylab.info: text label for the vertical (y) axis

input_log.label: log scale
input_log.info: character indicating if x or y or both coordinates should be plotted in log scale.

input_range.label: range
input_range.info: how far the plot whiskers extend out from the box. If range is positive, the whiskers extend to the most extreme data point which is no more than range times the interquartile range from the box. A value of zero causes the whiskers to extend to the data extremes.

input_manual_ylim.label: manually specify y-axis limits
input_manual_ylim.info: If checked, the values speciflied below will be used for y-axis minimum and maximum, rather than automatically computed.

input_ylim_min.label: y-axis min
input_ylim_min.info: If "manual y-axis limits" is checked, this value will be used for the y-axis minimum.

input_ylim_max.label: y-axis max
input_ylim_max.info: If "manual y-axis limits" is checked, this value will be used for the y-axis maximum.

input_col.label: colour (s)
input_col.info:
colour(s) for the bodies of the box plots.
Use , to separate multiple colors.
Colours in HEX format can be chosen on http://colorbrewer2.org/

input_notch.label: notch
input_notch.info: if true a notch is drawn in each side of the boxes. If the notches of two plots do not overlap this is ‘strong evidence’ that the two medians differ

input_sort.label: sort
input_sort.info: if true, boxes are sorted descending
